records.full_caption: Figure 1. (a) Applied potential waveform as a function of time. Square-shaped dopings are applied for 60 s and range from 0.1 to 0.5 V. Each with a dedoping potential of 0 V lasting for 120 s in between each doping pulse. (b) Changes in the mass of the films when doped in four electrolytes with increasing concentrations. (c) Zoom-in schematic representation of p(g2T-TT)-NaCl(aq) system in the EQCM-D chamber during doping in low and high concentration electrolyte solutions. Bottom: the number of water molecules injected into the films at the end of the doping pulse and remaining in the film upon the subsequent dedoping pulse applied at 0 V as a function of NaCl concentration.
records.caption: Changes in the mass of the films when doped in four electrolytes with increasing concentrations.

Each with a dedoping potential of 0 V lasting for 120 s in between each doping pulse. (b) Changes in the mass of the films when doped in four electrolytes with increasing concentrations. Figure 3. (a) Out-of-plane (qz) and in-plane (qy) X-ray scattering lineouts for the (200) and (010) peaks, respectively, of p(g2T-TT) films doped with Na[ClO4] 10 mM (black lines) and Na[ClO4] 1 M (green lines). Numbers in parentheses correspond to different conditions of the polymer: (1) dry, as-cast, (2) immersed in electrolyte, (3) doped at 0.5 V vs VOC, and (4) subsequently dedoped at VOC. Asterisks denote position of scattering peaks after lattice distortion induced by electrochemical doping. Dashed lines correspond to center of scattering peaks. (b) Lattice spacing values of the π–π stacking and lamellar distances extracted from fitting peak diffraction positions of the (010) and (200) peaks, respectively. Error bars in lattice spacing correspond to propagated error from peak fitting.
records.caption: Out-of-plane (qz) and in-plane (qy) X-ray scattering lineouts for the (200) and (010) peaks, respectively, of p(g2T-TT) films doped with Na[ClO4] 10 mM (black lines) and Na[ClO4] 1 M (green lines). Numbers in parentheses correspond to different conditions of the polymer: (1) dry, as-cast, (2) immersed in electrolyte, (3) doped at 0.5 V vs VOC, and (4) subsequently dedoped at VOC. Asterisks denote position of scattering peaks after lattice distortion induced by electrochemical doping. Dashed lines correspond to center of scattering peaks.

records.full_caption: Figure 3. Numbers in parentheses correspond to different conditions of the polymer: (1) dry, as-cast, (2) immersed in electrolyte, (3) doped at 0.5 V vs VOC, and (4) subsequently dedoped at VOC. Asterisks denote position of scattering peaks after lattice distortion induced by electrochemical doping. Dashed lines correspond to center of scattering peaks. (b) Lattice spacing values of the π–π stacking and lamellar distances extracted from fitting peak diffraction positions of the (010) and (200) peaks, respectively. Error bars in lattice spacing correspond to propagated error from peak fitting.
records.caption: Lattice spacing values of the π–π stacking and lamellar distances extracted from fitting peak diffraction positions of the (010) and (200) peaks, respectively. Error bars in lattice spacing correspond to propagated error from peak fitting.

records.full_caption: Figure 4. (a) Molecular structure of p(g2T-TT) showing the distribution of charge, with increasing electron density from blue to red. (b) Characteristic Raman spectrum of p(g2T-TT) film recorded in air. The peaks labeled with A, B, and C are attributed to C═C stretching, thiophenethiophene core (≈1406 cm−1), C═C symmetric stretching (≈1448 cm−1), and C═C/C−C asymmetric stretching/ shrinking (≈1494 cm−1), respectively. The region between ca. 1000 and 1300 cm−1 is mainly due to the side chains. (c) Changes in the Raman spectra of identically prepared films during doping in NaCl(aq) 10 mM (black lines) and NaCl(aq) 1 M (green lines). The spectra were recorded after the film was dry, i.e., air (1), immersed in electrolyte (2), doped at −0.5 V vs Ag/AgCl (3), and subsequently dedoped at Voc (4).
records.caption: Changes in the Raman spectra of identically prepared films during doping in NaCl(aq) 10 mM (black lines) and NaCl(aq) 1 M (green lines). The spectra were recorded after the film was dry, i.e., air (1), immersed in electrolyte (2), doped at −0.5 V vs Ag/AgCl (3), and subsequently dedoped at Voc (4).

The region between ca. 1000 and 1300 cm−1 is mainly due to the side chains. The spectra were recorded after the film was dry, i.e., air (1), immersed in electrolyte (2), doped at −0.5 V vs Ag/AgCl (3), and subsequently dedoped at Voc (4).

Figure 4. (a) Molecular structure of p(g2T-TT) showing the distribution of charge, with increasing electron density from blue to red. (b) Characteristic Raman spectrum of p(g2T-TT) film recorded in air. The peaks labeled with A, B, and C are attributed to C═C stretching, thiophenethiophene core (≈1406 cm−1), C═C symmetric stretching (≈1448 cm−1), and C═C/C−C asymmetric stretching/ shrinking (≈1494 cm−1), respectively. The region between ca. 1000 and 1300 cm−1 is mainly due to the side chains. (c) Changes in the Raman spectra of identically prepared films during doping in NaCl(aq) 10 mM (black lines) and NaCl(aq) 1 M (green lines). The spectra were recorded after the film was dry, i.e., air (1), immersed in electrolyte (2), doped at −0.5 V vs Ag/AgCl (3), and subsequently dedoped at Voc (4).
records.caption: Molecular structure of p(g2T-TT) showing the distribution of charge, with increasing electron density from blue to red.

records.full_caption: Figure 6. Schematic representation of an OECT channel composed of p(g2T-TT) and gated with an Ag/AgCl electrode immersed in NaCl(aq) solutions with different ion concentrations. The magnified region depicts the polymer−electrolyte interface and the differences in the swelling behavior of the film in low- and high-concentration electrolyte.

Figure 5. Gate voltage dependence of the (a) drain current (ID) and (b) transconductance of OECTs comprising p(g2T-TT) in the channel (W = 100 μm, L = 10 μm, d = 120 nm). The devices are measured in NaCl(aq) solutions of varying ion concentrations at VG = −0.5 V. (c) Hole mobility (μOECT) of p(g2T-TT) film as a function of NaCl(aq) concentration, calculated from the bandwidth measurements performed at VG = VD = −0.5 V as shown in Figure S13a. The error bars are derived from four different OECT channels measured at each concentration. (d) Response time of the OECTs (τOECT) as a function of NaCl concentration measured at VG = VD = −0.5 V.
records.caption: Hole mobility (μOECT) of p(g2T-TT) film as a function of NaCl(aq) concentration, calculated from the bandwidth measurements performed at VG = VD = −0.5 V as shown in Figure S13a. The error bars are derived from four different OECT channels measured at each concentration.
